instruction: What metric was chosento assess the potential for measuring brain intrinsic activity to identify minimal hepatic encephalopathy (MHE) in cirrhotic patients, and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to determine the discriminative ReHo-map for minimal hepatic encephalopathy (MHE) in cirrhotic patients was the support vector machine (SVM) method. The SVM-classifier was applied using leave-one-out cross-validation.

In terms of accuracy and sensitivity, the optimized discriminative model using the SVM approach and brain intrinsic activity measurement achieved a total accuracy of 82.9% and a sensitivity of 81.3%. This indicates that the SVM method was able to accurately identify and classify patients with MHE based on their resting-state fMRI data.
